metadata.title: UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (CRPD) - Ratification Status
metadata.description: Ratification and signature status for the CRPD and its Optional Protocol, by country

treaty.name: Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities

optional_protocol.name: Optional Protocol to the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities
optional_protocol.purpose: Establishes an individual communications procedure and an inquiry procedure for the CRPD

fields.country: Country or territory name as used by the UN
fields.region: UN geoscheme regional grouping (Africa, Americas, Asia-Pacific, Europe, MENA)
fields.crpd_signature_date: Date the country signed the CRPD (ISO 8601)
fields.crpd_ratification_date: Date the country ratified, acceded to, or formally confirmed the CRPD (ISO 8601)
fields.crpd_action_type: Type of action: ratification (signed then ratified), accession (joined without signing), or succession
fields.optional_protocol_signature_date: Date the country signed the Optional Protocol (ISO 8601)
fields.optional_protocol_ratification_date: Date the country ratified or acceded to the Optional Protocol (ISO 8601)

notes: Accession means a state joins the treaty without having previously signed it
Succession means a newly independent state assumes treaty obligations of its predecessor
The CRPD was adopted by the UN General Assembly on 13 December 2006
The CRPD entered into force on 3 May 2008 after the 20th ratification
The Optional Protocol enables individual complaints and inquiry procedures
Regional classification follows UN geoscheme groupings
Some countries may have signed but not yet ratified (signature indicates intent but is not legally binding)

countries.country: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
